summary: Fairies are mythical creatures often described as small, human-like beings with magical powers. They appear in European folklore, especially in Celtic, Slavic, and Germanic traditions. Stories about fairies come from various cultural beliefs. Some say they are fallen angels or spirits of the dead. Fairies are known for their tricks and living in a magical realm. People used charms like four-leaf clovers to protect themselves from fairies. They were also blamed for illnesses in the past. Fairies are popular in literature and art, especially during the Victorian era.
title: Fairy
